attributes.action: Make it unlawful to question any potential employee about childcare arrangements and not to base any decisions on these arrangements when appointing an employee.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
I left my job upon the birth of my third child and have been a stay at home mum for just over two years. 
I have been actively seeking employment for about a year now. I have always worked up until I left my last job, I am intelligent, have various qualifications and I have been more than capable of carrying out the duties required for the jobs I have applied for.
However, on far too many occasions, my interviews have been more like an interrogation as to where I'm going to park my kids off to when I go to work, and the usual what if's? 
Employers should ask questions relevant to the job and not base their questioning on the applicants ability to find suitable childcare, nor should they use the fact that somebody has children as an excuse not to employ them.
This is discrimination at it's worst, because no one is able to stop these people getting away with it
